summary.p: 434 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4572; Text: Q 1-114 (?); 16 lines per page; Dimensions: 220 x 280 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise textual information on Sura beginnings or endings. Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 2: "5 Y. 4572 Aynı Eser Parşömen. 220mm boy ve 280mm eninde cönk şeklinde 434 yaprak. Sahifede kûfi ile 230mm uzunl.[uğunda] 16 satır. Tahminen II. (VIII) asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Başta bulunan bir kayıt Hz. Ali tarafından yazıldığını ifade ediyor. İlk 8 yaprağı ile 423 den 432 e kadar olan yaprakları kâğıt üzerine harekeli nesihle sonradan yazılmış ve ilâve edilmiştir. Başta zahriye ile ilk iki sahifenin alt ve üst kısımları müzehheptir. Şemse ve kitabeli açık kahverengi deri cilt." which could be translated into English as follows: "5 Y. 4572. A Codex of the Qurʾān. Parchment. 434 oblong/horizontally shaped folia of 220 mm height and 280 mm width. The text written in Kufic script [contains] 16 lines measuring 230 mm. Probably copied during 2nd (8th) century. The record, at the incipit, state that this was copied by [the Caliph] ʿAlī. The first 8 folia and folia 423 to 432 were written on paper with vowel marked naskh and added later. The frontispiece [zahriye] at the beginning, the top and bottom parts of the first two folia are decorated [müzehhep]. Light brown leather binding with flap [miklep] and mandorla [şemse]".
